recipes.title: Applesauce
ingredients: Desired spices: Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Allspice, Ginger
instructions: Peel and core apples and cut into chunks. Place in a large pot on the stove with 1" of water in the bottom of the pot.
Cover and boil until soft
Use a masher tool or mixer to blend apples. Add desired spices and mix.
Freezes well in glass jars after they are cooled.

recipes.title: Asian Slaw
ingredients: 1 pound - Rainbow Slaw (can buy pre-packaged in produce section - any mix is fine)
1 1/2 cups - Almonds or Macadamia Nuts, crushed
instructions: Combine all slaw ingredients in a large bowl, mix and set aside.
Combine all dressing ingredients in a medium bowl and mix well. Drizzle over the slaw mixture. Toss well to coat.
Refrigerate before serving.

recipes.title: Asparagus & Mushroom Salad
instructions: Trim ends of asparagus and cut in half on diagonal. Place in a saucepan of boiling water and cook for 1 minute. Drain and plunge into cold water. Set aside.

In a separate saucepan, place mustard, juices, zests, garlic and honey. Season with pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and add the mushrooms. Toss for 2 minutes. Cool. Remove the mushrooms from the sauce with a slotted spoon.
Return the sauce to the heat, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 3-5 minutes until reduced and syrupy. Cool slightly.
Toss the mushrooms, spinach, and drained asparagus together. Serve drizzled with sauce.

recipes.title: Avocado Citrus Salad
ingredients: 4 1/2 tsp - Jalapeno Pappers, seeded and minced
2 - Avocados, halved, pitted, peeled, and sliced
instructions: Combine cucumber and onion in a medium bowl.
In a small bowl, combine 3 Tbsp grapefruit juice, oil, honey, peppers and salt until well blended. Pour mixture over cucumber mix and toss.
Add grapefruit and avocado and gently toss again.
Divide lettuce onto plates and top with an equal portion of mixture.

recipes.title: Baked Sweet Potatoes
ingredients: Sea Salt and Black Pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Peel the sweet potatoes and chop into 1 inch pieces. In a medium sized bowl, toss the sweet potato pieces with the coconut oil to coat them evenly.
In a small mixing bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients. Mix and add to the sweet potatoes. Toss to spread the spices evenly.
Place the potatoes evenly on a baking sheet and bake for about 30 minutes or until potatoes are fork tender.

recipes.title: Balsamic Brussel Sprouts
ingredients: 1 Stalk or Bag of Fresh Brussel Sprouts, washed and halved
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet on low/medium heat.
Add brussel sprouts.
Cook for about 12 minutes, stirring frequently. Add more oil if it begins to stick to the pan.
Add balsamic vinegar and stir for 1 more minute.
Remove from heat and serve warm.

recipes.title: Braised Cabbage and Apples
ingredients: 3 - Apples (skin on), cored and sliced into thin wedges
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Heat coconut oil oven medium-low heat. Add leeks and saute 3-5 minutes until softened. Stir in garlic, thyme, salt and pepper to taste and saute for 1 more minute.
Add the apples, cherries and broth and stir to combine. Transfer to a large rectangle baking dish. Fold in the cabbage, cover the dish and place in the oven for 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Broccoli Salad
instructions: Mix dressing, pour over cooked bacon and broccoli.
Add other ingredients and mix well.

recipes.title: Brussel Sprout Pecan Salad
ingredients: Optional: Cooked Turkey Bacon, chopped finely
instructions: In a skillet, melt coconut oil and saute sprouts until slightly browned and tender.
Cool the sprouts and mix in raisins and pecans (and bacon if desired).
Top with Balsamic vinegar and salt to taste.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash Casserole
ingredients: 1 - Butternut Squash, peeled, halved, seeded and thinly sliced
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Melt coconut oil in a glass dish in the oven. Place squash in a casserole dish and cover with onions. Sprinkle spices on top.
In a small bowl, whisk together juice, honey, coconut oil and pistachios. Pour over squash and bake until tender, about 1 hour.

recipes.title: Candied Carrots
instructions: Steam the carrots and dates for 7-8 minutes. Remove from heat.
Add coconut oil and salt. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Cauliflower Salad
ingredients: 1 - Head Cauliflower, cut into bite sized pieces and steamed until tender
2 - Turnips, peeled, chopped and steamed until tender
1 1/2 cups - Avocado Mayo or Unsweetened Plain Coconut Milk Yogurt
instructions: Steam the cauliflower and turnips together in the same pot and cool.
In a large bowl, toss together the cauliflower, turnips, celery, onion, dill and parsley. Set aside.
In another bowl, whisk together vinegar, mayo/yogurt, mustard, celery seeds, pepper, salt and lemon juice. Mix well.
Pour the mixture over the veggies and mix until evenly coated. Chill for a couple hours.

recipes.title: Celery Wagons
instructions: Wash celery and cut into 2-3" pieces.
Stick a toothpick through each end of the celery piece and slide a carrot onto each end for the wheels. Spread almond butter onto the celery.
Add your drivers and drive it into your mouth!!

recipes.title: Cilantro Cauliflower Rice
ingredients: 1 - Head Cauliflower or 1 Bag Frozen Riced Cauliflower
Sea Salt and Black Pepper to taste
instructions: Shred the cauliflower with a grater.
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the coconut oil and place the shredded cauliflower into the skillet. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Saute for about 10 minutes, stirring gently to be sure it cooks through. Remove cauliflower from heat, add cilantro and mix well.

recipes.title: Collard Greens
ingredients: Sea Salt and Pepper to taste
instructions: Cook bacon and set aside. Chop in small pieces when cool.
Wash greens and chop them into small pieces. Chop the onion and garlic into fine pieces.
Add coconut oil to a large skillet and heat to melt it. Add onion, garlic and bacon and cook on medium/low until the onion is soft.
Add chicken broth, collard greens, and salt and pepper and cover. Simmer for 1 hour and 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Cracked Pepper and Chive Crackers
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.

In a medium bowl, whisk together almond flour, coconut flour, granulated onion, sea salt and pepper. Add the egg and mix well. Add the coconut oil and chives. Blend again until well incorporated. Place a piece of parchment paper on a baking sheet. Squeeze the dough into a ball in your hands. Place it on the parchment paper and press it down until it is a flat square, reshaping the edges as it cracks. Sprinkle the tops with additional pepper and press it down into the dough with your hands. Using a sharp knife, cut the dough into bite sized square pieces.

Bake the crackers for 9 minutes. Remove from the oven and carefully pull the crackers apart with a spatula. Bake for another 3-5 minutes until the centers are cooked and the edges are golden. Remove and lift parchment paper onto a wire rack to cool. Store in an airtight container. These are great with guacamole!

recipes.title: Creamy Cauliflower
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Grease an 8"x8" glass baking dish with coconut or avocado oil.
Steam the cauliflower for 6 minutes. Set aside.
While cauliflower is steaming, prepare the sauce. Add all ingredients except the cauliflower into a high speed blender and process until smooth and creamy.
Toss the cauliflower with half the sauce and pour into the baking dish. Top with remaining sauce.
Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until the top is browned.

recipes.title: Creamy Cauliflower Hummus
ingredients: 1/4 cup + 1 Tbsp - Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 - Lemon, juice and zest for garnish
Sea Salt and Black Pepper to taste
instructions: Steam the cauliflower.
Zest the lemon and set aside.

In a blender, combine cauliflower, olive oil, lemon juice and cumin until smooth. Scoop out the hummus from the blender and garnish with lemon zest and paprika. Serve with your choice of fresh sliced veggies and olives.

recipes.title: Creamy Coleslaw
ingredients: 1 cup - Red or Green Cabbage shredded
instructions: Combine veggies in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, prepare dressing.
Pour dressing over veggies and toss lightly to coat.
Cover and chill for 2-24 hours.

recipes.title: Cucumber Avocado Salad
ingredients: 2 Tbsp - Flax or Omega Fish Oil
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well.

recipes.title: Cumin Roasted Carrot Fries
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Melt the coconut oil in a glass dish in the oven until liquid.
Wash and peel the carrots and cut them lengthwise into thin strips. Toss them into a large bowl.
Mix the cumin, cinnamon, parsley, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Add the melted coconut oil and mix well.
Pour the seasoning over the chopped carrots and toss to mix well until carrots are evenly covered.
Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper. Spread the carrots onto the parchment paper in a single layer and bake for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Curried Cauliflower
ingredients: 1 - Head of Cauliflower, cut into large florets
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Whisk together the almond butter, coconut oil, curry powder and salt.
Toss the cauliflower and chopped almonds in the curry mixture.
Spread out the cauliflower in a single layer on a parchment paper lined cookie sheet. Bake for 10 min. or until golden brown and just tender when pierced. Flip halfway through if necessary.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Dill Carrots
ingredients: 1 Tbsp - Snipped Fresh Dill OR 1/2 tsp Dried Dill
instructions: In a medium saucepan, cook carrots covered in a small amount of boiling water (or steam) for 10 minutes or until crisp-tender.
Drain.
Stir in oil, dill, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Toss lightly to coat.

recipes.title: Fried Cauliflower
instructions: Chop cauliflower into bite size pieces.
Mix flours together in a medium sized bowl and set aside.
Melt coconut oil in a large skillet.
Pour coconut milk into a large bowl. Add chopped cauliflower to coconut milk and mix until coated.
In batches, transfer cauliflower into the bowl of flour and mix until covered.
Heat oil in skillet to medium. When hot, transfer flour-coated cauliflower into skillet one layer thick and fry it, flipping it regularly, until golden brown.
Use a slated spoon to remove cauliflower pieces from the skillet and set on a plate lined with paper towel.
Repeat with the remaining cauliflower.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.title: Garlic Rosemary Dinner Rolls
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl with just 3 Tbsp of the coconut flour.
Melt the coconut oil. Set about 1 Tbsp aside for later.
In a separate bowl, combine the rest of the melted coconut oil, water and vinegar.
Stir the wet mixture into the dry mixture and combine.
Whisk the egg and add to the mixture. Then stir in the last 2 Tbsp of coconut flour one at a time, allowing the dough to set after each one.
Wet your hands with warm water. Shape the dough into about 8 balls and place spaced apart on the baking sheet. Lightly brush the tops of each roll with melted coconut oil.
Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve Warm.

recipes.title: Grain Free Stuffing
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Heat the coconut oil in an oven safe skillet over medium heat.
Add the onion, celery, apple, dates, parsley, adobo seasoning, salt and pepper and saute until soft, about 8 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in almond flour and mix well. Then stir in eggs and mix well.
Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until browned on top.

recipes.title: Guacamole
recipes.notes: Goes great with the recipe for 'Cracked Pepper and Chive Crackers
instructions: Mix together and enjoy.

recipes.title: Kohlrabi Bosc Pear Salad
ingredients: 1 Tbsp - White Balsamic Vinegar Sea Salt
1 Tbsp - Avocado Oil or Olive Oil
instructions: In a small bowl, toss the pistachios with the oil and set aside. Toss the rest of the ingredients in a bowl.
Add the nuts and enjoy!

recipes.title: Oven Roasted Veggies
ingredients: 3 - Medium Sweet Potatoes, peeled and cut into 1 inch pieces
2 - Medium Carrots, halved lengthwise and cut into pieces
Optional: Rutabaga, Parsnips or Winter Squash (skinned and cubed)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In an oiled 9x13 baking dish, combine potatoes, carrots, beets, onion and other optional ingredients.
In a separate bowl, combine oil, herb, lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper. Drizzle over veggies, toss to coat.
Bake covered for 45 min, stirring once.
Increase oven temperature to 450 degrees. Bake uncovered about 20 minutes or until veggies are tender and brown on edges, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Potato Salad
instructions: Boil eggs for 12 minutes, rinse and set aside to cool.
Peel, chop and boil potatoes in a large stock pot until tender (about 8-10 min). Drain and return to the pot. Drizzle with vinegar and set aside to cool for 25 minutes.
In a medium bowl, whisk together mayo, celery salt, mustard and relish. Add to potatoes and mix well.
Then add in celery, onion and hard boiled eggs (chopped). Toss until combined. Season with salt and pepper, and top with a sprinkle of paprika.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours and serve cold.

recipes.title: Roasted Carrots and Fennel
ingredients: 3 - Medium Fennel Bulbs, stalks discarded, chopped into 1.2 inch thick wedges
6 - Carrots, peeled and cut lengthwise into 3" pieces
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
In a large bowl, toss all ingredients together. Spread in a single layer in a roasting pan.
Bake for about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Roasted Leek Spinach Salad with Poached Eggs
ingredients: 4 - Medium Leeks, cut into 1 in. chunks
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Toss leeks with 2 Tbsp coconut oil in a glass dish. Season with salt and pepper if desired. Roast in the oven for 45 minutes or until golden, stirring several times.
Meanwhile, whisk together lemon juice, mustard and remaining 1 Tbsp coconut oil in a small bowl.
Fill a large skillet with 2 inches of water and bring to a boil. Add eggs and reduce heat to med-low. Poach eggs for 5-7 minutes, spooning simmering water over eggs.
Toss spinach with mushrooms, roasted leeks, and dressing in a large bowl.
Divide salad among 6 plates and top each with one poached egg.

recipes.title: Roasted Squash, Parsnips and Leeks
ingredients: 2 Tbsp - Melted Coconut Oil, or Avocado Oil
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well.
Spread out the mixture on the baking sheet and roast for 45 minutes.

recipes.title: Sesame Asparagus
instructions: Snap off and discard woody bases from fresh asparagus.
Cut asparagus into 1 in. pieces
Steam asparagus in a small amount of boiling water for 4-6 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain.
In the same pan, melt coconut oil and add sesame seed. Cook and stir over medium heat until seed is toasted.
Add mushrooms. Cook and stir for about 4 minutes or until tender.
Add lemon juice and olive oil.
Add aspargus back in, toss to coat.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Salad with Apple and Avocado
ingredients: 3 Sweet Potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2 cubes
instructions: Place sweet potatoes in large saucepan. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Cook until potatoes are tender. Drain and rinse under cold water to cool.
Drain well.
Combine apple, onion, cilantro and lime juice in a large bowl.
Stir in sweet potatoes, oil and pine nuts.
Stir in avocado just before serving. Season with salt and pepper if desired.

recipes.title: Almond Butter Balls
instructions: Mis all ingredients together in a bowl until combined.
Pack into tight bite-size balls.
Refrigerate or freeze immediately

recipes.title: Almond Paleo Pancakes
instructions: Whisk 2 eggs in a small bowl. Add applesauce, maple syrup and vanilla.
Next, add almond flour and baking powder. Mix until combined.
Grease skillet with coconut oil and heat to medium. Once it is fully heated, spoon about 3 tablespoons of batter for each pancake.
Let cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side. Flip quickly with a spatula.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Apple Bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a loaf pan with parchment paper so the ends hang over the sides.
Combine applesauce, eggs, coconut oil, maple syrup and vanilla in a blender and pulse a few times to combine. Scrape down the side and blend for 30 seconds until smooth.
Add coconut flour, arrowroot starch, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and sea salt and blend again for 30 seconds. Stir in chopped apple with the batter.
Transfer batter to loaf pan and smooth into an even layer.
Combine ingredients for the topping in a small bowl and stir together to coat. Distribute over top of the batter in the loaf pan.
Bake for 50 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool for 30 min. before removing from the pan by lifting it up using the parchment paper. Slice and serve warm, store in the fridge up to a week or freeze.

recipes.title: Apple Cinnamon Waffles
ingredients: Toppings: Fresh Fruit, Pure Maple Syrup
instructions: Melt coconut oil.
Combine together the dry ingredients.
In a separate bowl, combine together the egg yolks, vanilla, coconut milk, apple and melted coconut oil. Mix in with the dry ingredients.
With a mixer, whip the egg whites until frothy.
Fold the egg whites into the batter gently, just enough to mix.
Preheat waffle iron. Follow directions for waffle iron to cook.

recipes.title: Apple Egg Muffins
ingredients: 3 large Green Apples, chopped into 1/2 in. pieces
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium skillet, saute apples, water and 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon until the apples are the consistency of chunky applesauce. Allow the mixture to cool before combining with the egg mixture.

In a medium sized bowl, whisk the eggs, coconut oil, coconut milk, coconut flour, 1/2 tsp. cinnamon, baking soda and salt until well combined. Add the cooled apple mixture, reserving 1/4 cup for a garnish.
Spoon mixture into lined muffin tins. Spoon 1 tsp of apples on top of each muffin. Bake for 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Banana Pancakes
ingredients: 3 Tbsp - Melted Coconut Oil OR Avocado Oil
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and process for 2-3 minutes until smooth.
Grease a griddle with coconut or avocado oil and heat to medium.
Pour 1/2 cup of batter on griddle to form pancakes.
Cook for 4-5 min. on one side, then flip and cook for 1-2 min. more.

recipes.title: Blueberry Almond Crumb Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease muffin pan with coconut oil.
Set aside 2 tbsp of almond flour. In a mixing bowl, combine remaining almond flour, coconut flour and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, honey, vanilla, and almond extract. Then add to dry ingredients and mix thoroughly.
Fold in blueberries, then pour batter into muffin cups. Pat the tops down into rounded heaps and use a brush to dab with melted coconut oil. Sprinkle with remaining almond flour.
Bake for 30-40 min. The top should be springy, yet firm when ready. (For mini-muffins, bake for 26 min.)

recipes.title: Breakfast Bowl
ingredients: Sea Salt and Pepper to taste
instructions: Put 1/2 the red onion in a skillet with the coconut oil and cook until soft. Add cauliflower rice and cook until tender. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.
To make pico de gallo, combine all the ingredients and mix well. Set aside.
Fry the eggs in a skillet.
Serve cauliflower rice in a bowl, topped with fried egg, pico de gallo and a sliced avocado.

recipes.title: Breakfast Hash
ingredients: 1 Small Sweet Potato, peeled and diced
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Dice the sweet potato and place in the oven to bake for about 40 minutes or until soft (while you prepare the rest of the recipe).

In a large skillet, melt the coconut oil. Add the onion and saute for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and spices and saute for 5 minutes. Add the sausage and cook until done. Remove from heat and set aside.
Prepare the eggs to your liking (poached, over easy, scrambled, etc).
Prepare plates. Start with a scoop of the meat mixture. Top with sweet potatoes. Add the eggs on top.

recipes.title: Breakfast Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, mix together the dry ingredients. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs until light and frothy. Add vanilla and maple syrup and whisk to combine.

Add the dry ingredients to the egg mixture and blend well. Stir in the carrots, zucchini, coconut, walnuts, dried cherries and pumpkin seeds until incorporated. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper liners, and divide the batter among them. Bake the muffins for 25-30 minutes or until they are browned and the centers spring back to the touch. Let cool for 10 minutes, then remove muffins and let cool completely on a wire rack.
Store in an airtight container in the fridge, or freeze for later user. These are great for on-the-go!

recipes.title: Breakfast Quiche
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, melt coconut oil. Add onion and saute until softened. Add sausage to the skillet and cook until done all the way through, breaking up the pieces. Remove from heat.
Grease an 8"x8" glass baking dish. Sprinkle the sausage mixture over the bottom of the dish.
In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, sea salt, pepper and Italian seasoning. Pour egg mixture over sausage mixture in the baking dish. Sprinkle some salt and pepper on top.
Bake for 25-30 min or until lightly browned on top and the center is set. Let cool completely on a wire rack. Slice and eat!

These can be frozen. Just put a piece of parchment paper between each layer and seal in an airtight container. When ready to eat, thaw in the fridge overnight and reheat in the oven at 325 degrees for about 20 min.

recipes.title: Breakfast Skillet
ingredients: 1 Package of Organic Chicken Sausages, sliced OR 1 Pound Bulk Chicken Sausage
instructions: Place 1 Tbsp of coconut oil in a skillet, add sausage, and stir until cooked through.
Remove meat from skillet and set aside. Return skillet to heat and add 1 Tbsp coconut oil.
Saute the onion for 3 minutes. Then add the squash, apple, kale and salt and continue cooking for another 10 minutes, until squash is tender.
Return the sausage to the pan and cook for another minute to heat through.
Serve with fried eggs (optional) on top if desired.

recipes.title: Breakfast Veggie Stir Fry
ingredients: 1 Medium Sweet Potato, peeled and chopped
instructions: Melt the coconut oil in a large skillet on med-low heat.
Add celery root and sweet potato and cook, stirring regularly, for 12 minutes.
Add asparagus, salt and seasoning and cook for another 10 minutes.
Add basil and cook for another 4 minutes.
Remove from heat. Garnish with chives and serve.

recipes.title: Chai Streusel Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
For the muffins: In a large mixing bowl, add almond flour, coconut sugar, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
In a separate bowl, add eggs, avocado oil and apple cider vinegar. Mix until eggs are beaten.
Slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir until a batter forms.
For the Streusel: Place all of the dry ingredients into a bowl and mix, then add the coconut oil. Using a fork, press ingredients together until small crumbs form.
Line a muffin tin with muffin liners and drop 2 Tbsp of batter into each liner. Sprinkle 2 teaspoons of the streusel on top of the batter.
Bake for 20-22 minutes, remove from the oven and let cool.

recipes.title: Cherry Pistachio Scones
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Place coconut oil in a glass dish in the oven to melt.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium sized bowl, combine all dry ingredients.
Add the eggs, maple syrup, vanilla extract and almond extract and blend. Slowly add the coconut oil and mix well.
Stir in the dried cherries. Cover and refrigerate dough for 1 hour.
Scoop the dough onto the baking sheet. Dust your hands with arrowroot starch and shape the dough into a 2" thick disc. Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven and carefully cut the dough into 8 triangle wedges, gently sliding them apart with the knife.
Bake for an additional 8-10 minutes or until golden brown and firm to the touch.
Place the parchment paper on a wire rack to cool completely.
Store in an airtight container or freeze for later user.

recipes.title: Chocolate Sweet Potato Waffles
recipes.notes: These can be frozen and put directly into the toaster to reheat when ready to eat!
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine dry ingredients.
Add wet ingredients and blend. If the batter is too thick, add more coconut milk.
Preheat waffle iron. Pour batter into waffle iron and cook.

recipes.title: Coconut Hot Cereal
ingredients: 1/4 cup - Coconut Flour TODO OR Green Banana Flour
1 Tbsp - Arrowroot Starch TODO OR Tapioca Starch
1 tsp - Raw Honey TODO OR Maple Syrup
instructions: Bring coconut milk, cinnamon and vanilla to a boil in a saucepan. Once boiling, add coconut flakes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat. Add coconut flour, arrowroot/tapioca starch and honey/maple syrup. Sprinkle in berries and top with a sliced banana.

recipes.title: Dr. Becky's Protein Bars
ingredients: 3 scoops Grass Fed Beef Vanilla Protein Powder
1/2 cup - Dark Chocolate Chips TODO OR Mix together 1/3 cup Carob Powder with 1/3 cup Melted Coconut Oil
instructions: Melt coconut oil. In a medium bowl, mix together coconut oil, applesauce, vanilla and sea salt until smooth.
Add banana flour and protein powder and mix well. Then add shredded coconut and mix again. Mixture will be thick.
Spread mixture into a glass 8" by 8" dish lined with parchment paper and press into a flat even layer. Refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Melt chocolate chips in a double boiler. Remove glass dish from the fridge and pour the chocolate over the top. Spread until even. Place back in the fridge for 2 to 4 hours. Remove and cut into bars.
Refrigerate until ready to eat or freeze for later use.

recipes.title: Frittata
instructions: Beat eggs and pepper, set aside.
In a 10 in. cast iron or ceramic skillet, cook onion and garlic in oil until tender. Stir in veggies.
Pour egg mixture into skillet over veggies.

Cook on the stove over medium heat. As mixture sets, run a spatula around edges and lift up, letting egg mixture flow underneath to cook. Continue cooking and lifting edges until the egg mixture is almost set (surface will be moist).
Place the skillet under a broiler 4-5 inches from the heat. Broil for 1-2 minutes or until the top is just set.
Remove, cool and cut into wedges. (Can be cooked in the oven instead at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until a knife comes out clean). Enjoy!

recipes.title: Fruit Pudding
ingredients: 1 cup - Any Berries or a combo (Raspberries, Strawberries, Blackberries, Blueberries
instructions: Add all ingredients to a high speed blender and blend for 1 minute.
Pour into individual serving sized bowls, cover and refrigerate.

recipes.title: Grain-Free Granola
recipes.notes: This Recipe is Great in a Pinch!
ingredients: Pecans, crushed (can use leftover Pecans from 'Baked Pecan' recipe for more flavor)
(You can use any combination of Nuts/Seeds and Dried Fruit
instructions: Crush the above mixture to a crumbled texture with a meat tenderizer. Store in an airtight container.
When ready to eat, sprinkle with cinnamon and serve in a bowl covered with almond or coconut milk.
If desired, drizzle a small bit of 100% pure maple syrup on top.

recipes.title: Grain-Free Granola Bars
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Line an 8"x8" square baking pan with parchment paper.
In a small saucepan over low heat, combine coconut oil, maple syrup, raw honey, almond butter and vanilla. Stir occasionally until ingredients have melted and mixed. Set aside to cool.

In a medium sized bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients. Pour the saucepan mixture over the seed mixture and stir to combine. Spoon mixture into the 8"x8" pan and use a spoon to spread it out evenly, pressing down firmly to compress it.
Bake the bars for 30-35 minutes until bubbly and golden. Remove from the oven and let cool for 1 hour.
Cut into bars. Place bars in an airtight container and store in the fridge (keeps up to a week), or wrap individually and freeze for future use.

recipes.title: Green Egg Muffins
ingredients: 1 box - Organic Applegate Farms Chicken Sausage
1 large Fistful of Spinach or Kale
2 Tbsp - Italian Seasoning (or your other favorite seasoning)
instructions: Heat oven to 350 degrees. Bake the sausages in the oven until warm. Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
Place all ingredients except the sausage in a blender and blend for 1 minute until well mixed.
Pour mixture into muffin cups with room to add sausage pieces.
Chop the sausage up into small bits and spread evenly into muffin cups.
For regular size muffins, bake for 30-35 min. For mini muffins, bake for 28 min. Remove from the oven and let cool.

recipes.title: Hashbrown, Sausage & Egg Muffins
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb - Sweet Potatoes, peeled and shredded
1/4 tsp plus 1/8 tsp - Sea Salt, divided
1/4 tsp plus 1/8 tsp - Black Pepper, divided
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Brush a 12 count muffin pan with coconut oil, thoroughly coating the base of each muffin cup.

Transfer potatoes to a colander and press firmly to extract as much water as possible. Squeeze between double layers of paper towels until sweet potatoes feel very dry. Transfer to a large bowl, add 1/4 tsp. each of salt and pepper and stir to combine.

Add about 1/3 cup potatoes to each muffin cup. Press sweet potatoes into the base and up the sides of each muffin cup, creating little "nests." (Note: Potatoes should come slightly over top of muffin cups, as they will shrink during baking).
Bake until the edges of the potatoes are golden brown, about 20 min, turning the pan halfway through. Reduce oven temp. to 350 degrees.
Lightly spread coconut oil around the top edges of each muffin cup. Sprinkle sausage and scallions evenly over the 12 muffin cups.
In a medium bowl, whisk eggs and remaining 1/8 tsp. each salt and pepper. Pour into "nest," dividing evenly.
Bake until egg is set, 12-15 min. Cool in pan for 10 min. before serving.

recipes.title: Lemon Chia Seed Muffins
ingredients: Zest and Juice from 1 Large Lemon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line muffin pan with 12 muffin liners.
In a medium bowl, combine flours, chia seeds, baking soda, baking powder, and sea salt.
In another bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Add the rest of the ingredients and whisk to combine.
Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and incorporate. Scoop mix into muffin pans. Bake for 23 minutes.
Allow to cool before serving.

recipes.title: No-Bake Coconut Balls
ingredients: 1 1/2 Tbsp- Cocoa Powder or Carob Powder
instructions: In a small bowl, mix all ingredients except shredded coconut. Roll into small balls with your hands and then roll in the shredded coconut to coat. Place in a glass dish and refrigerate until ready to eat.

recipes.title: No-Bake Protein Bars
ingredients: 4 scoops - Grass Fed Beef Protein Powder
instructions: Mix together ingredients. If needed, add more water, 1 tbsp. at a time until dough comes together. It should be very stiff and tacky.
Line a square baking dish with unbleached parchment paper. Place the dough in the dish and press it flat. Place it in the fridge for 20 minutes.
Remove from the fridge and use parchment paper to lift it out of the dish onto a cutting board. Slice the dough into desired bars.
These freeze well and are great to grab on the go!

recipes.title: Orange Cherry Muffins
recipes.notes: Substitute 1/2 a banana and 1/4 cup Applesauce instead of the two eggs.
ingredients: 1/2 cup - Raw Honey or Maple Syrup
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Place a glass dish filled with 2 cups of water on the bottom rack of the oven and place the other rack in the center of the oven.

Zest the orange and place into a high-speed blender. Slice the remaining orange in half and squeeze 1/4 cup of the juice into the blender. Add the rest of the ingredients except the cherries into the blender. Blend for 30 seconds. Scrape down the sides and blend again until smooth.
Stir in the cherries by hand. Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners. Spoon the batter into the cups, filling 2/3 of the way full. Bake for 24 minutes.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Tigernut Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup - Pumpkin or Winter Squash Puree
instructions: Scoop palm shortening into a small bowl and place in the fridge to chill ahead of time.
Combine the rest of the topping ingredients in a medium bowl. Cut in the chilled palm shortening but do not overmix- it should be crumbly. Store in the fridge until ready to use.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and line a muffin pan with 12 paper liners.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, pumpkin, coconut milk, coconut sugar, maple syrup and vanilla with a mixer until very smooth.
In a separate bowl, combine the tigernut flour, arrowroot, baking soda and pumpkin pie spiece. Slowly add to wet ingredients and beat with a mixer until smooth.
Pour batter into the muffin cups, dividing evenly. Spoon the topping mixture onto the top of each muffin and then bake for 20-25 minutes.
Let cool for 10 minutes and then remove muffins from tin to cool completely.
Store in the fridge or freezer.

recipes.title: Sausage & Celery Root Skillet
instructions: Chop celery root and add to a large skillet with coconut oil.
Cook on low-med for about 10 minutes.
Add chopped apples and cook for 7 more minutes. Then add mushrooms, garlic and sausage and cook until meat is cooked through.
Simple one-skillet easy and delicious breakfast!

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Almond Apple Cereal
recipes.notes: You can start this in the slow cooker before you go to bed and wake up to a ready-to-eat breakfast!
instructions: Peel and shred the apples and place them in the slow cooker.
Add remaining ingredients and stir well.
Cover and cook on LOW for 6 hours. Sweeten with honey or pure maple syrup to taste.

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Banana Bread
ingredients: 1/4 cup plus 2 Tbsp - Coconut Oil, melted
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, mash the bananas with a fork. Add the coconut oil, stir in the honey, vanilla, coconut milk and eggs, and mix well.
Add the flour and baking soda (the mixture will be thin, like pancake batter).
Line your slow cooker with unbleached parchment paper. Pour the banana mixture into the slow cooker, on top of the parchment paper and cook on LOW for 2 hours.
When the bread is done, remove it by lifting out the parchment paper and placing it on a cutting board to cool, or leave it in the slow cooker on warm and enjoy it all day!

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Sausage Hash
recipes.notes: You can start this in the slow cooker before you go to bed and wake up to a ready-to-eat breakfast!
ingredients: 3 Medium Sweet Potatoes, peeled and grated
1 Box Applegate Farm Chicken and Sage Sausage, chopped
instructions: Peel the sweet potatoes, shred them with a grater, and place them in the slow cooker.
Add the rest of the ingredients and stir together.
Cover and cook on LOW for 6-8 hours.

recipes.title: Grain Free Zucchini Bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Combine dry ingredients in a small bowl.
Add eggs to a large mixing bowl and beat with a mixer. Add other wet ingredients and beat until fully combined and frothy.
Slowly add the dry ingredients while mixing until all is incorporated.
Spoon batter into 2 mini loaf pans or into a lined muffin tin and bake for 35 min.

recipes.title: Balsamic Roast Beef
ingredients: 3 Sweet Potatoes, peeled and cut into pieces
Sea Salt and Black Pepper to Taste
instructions: Season the roast with salt and pepper.
Melt coconut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the roast for 2-3 minutes on each side.
Place the meat in the slow cooker. Top it with the leek, garlic, red wine (opt.), balsamic vinegar, beef broth, rosemary and bay leaves.
Cover the slow cooker and set it to low for 3 1/2 hours.
After the 3 1/2 hours, add the sweet potatoes and continue to cook on low for another 4 hours.
Remove and discard the bay leaves and rosemary sprigs.

Pour the liquid from the slow cooker into a saucepan and bring to a slow boil over medium-high heat. Keep it boiling and let it reduce until you get the desired consistency for your sauce (about 15 minutes).
Pour the sauce back into the slow cooker and serve with the meat and sweet potatoes.

recipes.title: Barbeque Apple Chicken
ingredients: 1 Bottle of Barbeque Sauce of your Choice (Our Favorite: Brownwood Farm's Cherry Barbeque Sauce)
instructions: Place all the ingredients in the slow cooker and cover and cook on LOW for 4-5 hours.

recipes.title: Beef and Veggie Soup
ingredients: 2 Tbsp - Fresh Basil Leaves, Finely Chopped
instructions: Melt the coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the beef in a single layer and cook until browned, about 8 minutes. Transfer the beef to the slow cooker.
Add the onions and garlic to the skillet and saute until softened, about 8 minutes. Transfer onions and garlic to a slow cooker, including any liquid in the skillet.
Add the broth and carrots to the slow cooker, set to low, and cook for 6 hours.
With 2 hours left of cook time, add the green beans, cauliflower, basil and parsley, and salt and pepper to taste.
Store leftovers in the fridge.

recipes.title: Beef Stew
ingredients: 2 lbs. - Grass Fed Stew Meat, Cut into 1” Cubes
Sea Salt and Pepper to Taste
instructions: Heat the avocado oil in a skillet. Add the meat and cook on medium/low heat until edges are browned.
Place meat in a slow cooker.  Add salt and pepper, and stir to coat.
Add remaining ingredients and stir to mix.  Cover and cook on LOW 8-10 hours (or HIGH 4-5 hours).
Stir thoroughly before serving.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: 2 Tbsp - Tapioca Starch or Arrowroot Powder
instructions: Saute the mushrooms, onions and beef in coconut oil in a skillet until almost cooked through. Transfer to crockpot.
Add the rest of the ingredients (except cauliflower rice) to the crockpot and cook on low for 4 hours.
Cook the cauliflower rice.
Serve the beef mixture over top of the cauliflower.

recipes.title: Bone Broth
recipes.notes: Bone broth is extremely healthy and VERY easy to make.  It contains beneficial building blocks for your body, like collagen, marrow, glycine, hyaluronic acid, chondroitin sulfate, calcium, magnesium and potassium. This is helpful in reducing inflammation and assisting in gut healing.
ingredients: Soup Bones (from a healthy organic grass fed/pasture raised animal)
2 Tbsp - Apple Cider Vinegar (this helps release the bone minerals)
instructions: Place the bones in your slow cooker. Wash the veggies and add them to the slow cooker, no need to chop. Cover ingredients with a generous amount of water. Add apple cider vinegar. Cover and cook on high for 18 to 24 hours.
Check water level periodically, more may need to be added. Strain the broth through a strainer and cool. Broth can be used for sipping, or adding to other recipes and soups.
You can store extra broth in glass mason jars in the freezer for future single serve use. Just leave ½ inch headspace in the jar and allow to cool completely before placing in the freezer.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash Lasagna
instructions: Place coconut oil in the bottom of a large soup pot on medium heat.  Add the carrots, onions, zucchini, and mushrooms and sauté until tender.
While veggies are cooking, brown the beef and sausage on medium heat in a separate skillet until fully cooked.  Add the beef/sausage mix to the veggies in the soup pot.
Add the remaining ingredients except for butternut squash, mix well, and simmer for 30 min.

While the sauce simmers, peel, halve, and scoop out the seeds of the butternut squash.  Cut the cleaned squash lengthwise in ¼” to 1/2 “ thick strips (resembling thick lasagna noodles).  It doesn't have to be perfect!
In the slow cooker, ladle in a layer of the meat sauce, then evenly spread the squash slices on top.  Continue to alternate until you have reached 4 layers or more.
Cover and cook on LOW for 4-6 hrs.

recipes.title: Chipotle Chicken Stew
instructions: Marinate the chicken breasts overnight.
The next day, place the coconut oil, onion, turnip, rutabaga, and squash in the slow cooker.
Cut the chicken and place it on top of the veggies (discard the marinade).
Add the rest of the ingredients, cover, and cook on LOW for 4-6 hrs.

recipes.title: Chipotle Meatballs
instructions: In a medium sized mixing bowl, thoroughly mix together all of the meatball ingredients with your hands and set aside.
Put the onion, garlic, tomato sauce and beef broth into the slow cooker and mix well.  Add the honey and spices and whisk together.
Form the meat mixture into balls, golf ball sized.  Gently drop each meatball into the sauce in the slow cooker.  Cover and cook on LOW for 6-7 hrs.  Serve garnished with cilantro.

recipes.title: Chocolate Almond Butter Swirl Brownies
instructions: In a small bowl, combine the almond meal, cocoa powder and baking powder.  In a separate bowl, combine the melted coconut oil and honey, and stir well.
Add the vanilla to the wet ingredients.  When the coconut oil has cooled, add the eggs.
Combine the wet and dry mixtures, stirring well.  Add the dark chocolate chips.
Line your slow cooker with parchment paper and pour in the mixture on top of it.  Drop the almond butter on top of the mixture, and using a knife, swirl it around.
Cover and cook on LOW for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chili
instructions: Heat a large skillet on medium-high heat, then add coconut oil.  When oil is melted, add onions and cook until translucent.  Add garlic.
Crumble the ground meat into the skillet and stir to combine.  Continue to cook meat mixture, stirring often until it is cooked through.
Add it to a large crockpot.  Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well.  Set the crockpot on low for 2.5 hours.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Ginger Lamb
instructions: Place the cinnamon sticks on the bottom of the slow cooker.
Place the lamb on top of the cinnamon sticks.
Chop the onion and carrots and place them on top of the lamb.
Add the garlic and ginger and remaining spices.
Cover and cook on LOW for 8 hrs.

recipes.title: Crockpot Hamburger Soup
instructions: Brown the ground beef in a skillet on medium-low heat, then add to the crockpot.
Add all other ingredients and turn the crockpot on high for 5 hours.

recipes.title: Egg Roll Soup
ingredients: 2 Tbsp - Tapioca Starch or Arrowroot Powder
instructions: Brown the meat in the coconut oil in a skillet until almost browned. Transfer the meat to the slow cooker. Add the remaining ingredients except for the tapioca starch. Cook on low for 5 hours.
Before serving, remove ¼ cup of the liquid from the crockpot, add tapioca starch to the liquid and mix well. Pour it back into the crockpot and stir well to thicken.

recipes.title: Fiesta Lime Chicken
instructions: Thinly slice the onions into strips and place them in the slow cooker.
Cut one lime in half and squeeze juice over the onions.
Place the chicken on top of the onions and evenly sprinkle with half of the taco seasoning.  Turn the chicken over and season the other side with remaining seasoning.
Squeeze the remaining limes over the chicken and add the chicken broth.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 3.5 hours.

recipes.title: Lectin Free Chili
ingredients: 1 - Medium Onion or 3 Small Leeks, Chopped
instructions: Bake the sweet potato for about an hour at 375 degrees and set aside. (this can be done the day before if desired).
Cook the ground beef and 1 tsp. salt in a skillet until broken up in small pieces and about halfway cooked. Transfer to crockpot.

Use the same skillet to heat avocado oil. Then add garlic, onion, and celery and cook for 5 minutes until soft. Add the chili powder, cumin, cinnamon and cloves and stir, cooking for 1 more minute. Pour in the broth, scraping the bottom of the pan and transfer to the crockpot.
Add to the crockpot: pine nuts, sweet potato puree, adobo seasoning, wine vinegar, coconut aminos, 2 tsp. salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and cook on low for 5 hours.

recipes.title: Maple Roasted Chicken with Sweet Potatoes
ingredients: 2 Sweet Potatoes, Peeled and Cut into 1" Chunks
instructions: Place all ingredients into the slow cooker.
Cook on Low for 6 hours.

recipes.title: Meatloaf
ingredients: 1/2 cup - Crushed Almond Crackers (We use Simple Mills Sea Salt)
Top with Barbeque Sauce (Our Favorite- Brownwood Farm's Cherry Barbeque Sauce)
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Shape into a loaf and place in a slow cooker.
Top with sauce. Cook on low for 3.5-4 hours.

recipes.title: Mild shredded Chicken
recipes.notes: Super easy and quick!! Great to serve over the top of a salad or other greens.
ingredients: All Natural Barbeque Sauce (Our favorite is Brownwood Farms Cherry Barbeque Sauce)
instructions: Place the chicken breasts in the slow cooker and pour the sauce over them.
Cover and cook on low for 4 hours.
When done, shred the chicken with a knife and fork and mix well.

recipes.title: Sesame Orange Chicken
instructions: Place chicken in the slow cooker. Place the remaining crockpot ingredients in a bowl, whisk together, and pour over the chicken. Flip the chicken over to fully coat. Cook the chicken on low for 4 hours.
Remove the chicken from the sauce and chop it into bite size pieces. Transfer the sauce from the crockpot into a small saucepan. Return the chicken to the crockpot and cover to keep warm.
Add tapioca flour to the sauce and simmer on the stovetop over medium heat until it becomes thickened. Pour back over the chicken in the crockpot.
Heat the cauliflower rice in a pot until warm.
Spoon the mixture onto plates on top of the cauliflower rice. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and top with chopped green onions.

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Almond Apple Cereal
recipes.notes: You can start this in the slow cooker before you go to bed and wake up to a ready-to-eat breakfast!
instructions: Peel and shred the apples and place them in the slow cooker.
Add remaining ingredients and stir well.
Cover and cook on LOW for 6 hours. Sweeten with honey or pure maple syrup to taste.

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Banana Bread
ingredients: 1/4 cup plus 2 Tbsp - Coconut Oil, melted
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, mash the bananas with a fork. Add the coconut oil, stir in the honey, vanilla, coconut milk and eggs, and mix well.
Add the flour and baking soda (the mixture will be thin, like pancake batter).
Line your slow cooker with unbleached parchment paper. Pour the banana mixture into the slow cooker, on top of the parchment paper and cook on LOW for 2 hours.
When the bread is done, remove it by lifting out the parchment paper and placing it on a cutting board to cool, or leave it in the slow cooker on warm and enjoy it all day!

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Ham
instructions: Decorate the outside of the ham by inserting as many whole cloves as you like into it (just push the smaller side in toward the center of the ham, so it is sticking out the top). Or, sprinkle ground cloves on the top.

Place ham in the slow cooker.  Pour both juices over the top and Drizzle the ham with the maple syrup.  Cover and cook on LOW for 8 hours or until the internal temp. reaches 160 degrees. (If you are using a fully pre-cooked ham, cook on LOW for 2 hrs. and then set to warm until ready to eat).

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Short Ribs
instructions: Season the ribs on all sides with salt and pepper.
Melt coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sear the ribs  on each of the 4 sides for about 60 seconds on each side. Set aside.
Pour the beef broth, worcestershire sauce, garlic powder and onion powder into a slow cooker and stir together.
Place the ribs into the liquid in the slow cooker. Spoon the liquid over the top of the ribs to saturate.
Place the rosemary sprig on top of the meat and place the lid on the slow cooker.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours.

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Whole Chicken
recipes.notes: After we eat the chicken for dinner, we strain the liquid from the slow cooker into a stock pot, add a little extra water, throw in some veggies and a few spices and pick off the rest of the chicken meat from the bones left over (you can use the pieces of meat that no one likes to eat at dinner, like the back meat).  It makes a very yummy soup that will last a couple days.  This really makes the extra cost of a pasture raised bird worth it! While the soup (above) is cooking, we will take the remaining bones and put them back into the crockpot, cover completely with water and follow the bone broth recipe in the “Soups and Sauces” section of this cookbook! Simple, easy and healthy way to get the most out of a single bird!
ingredients: Your Favorite Spices (Chophouse Seasoning, Sea Salt and/or Chicken Rub Spice)
instructions: Add a few inches of water to the bottom of the slow cooker (this can be used after the chicken is cooked as a base to make veggie soup-see below).  Rinse the chicken and place it into the slow cooker.  Add spices.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 4 hours or LOW for 6 hours.

recipes.title: Slow Cooker Chicken Tortilla Soup
ingredients: 1 1/2 tsp - Sea Salt, Divided in Half
1 tsp - Ground Pepper, Divided in Half
instructions: Add ingredients listed above with half of the salt and pepper into the crockpot.
Cook on high for 4 hours.
Prior to serving, remove the chicken breasts from the crockpot, shred and season with remaining salt and pepper, and place back in the crockpot.
Stir.

recipes.title: Southern Sweet Potato Soup
ingredients: 2 Large Sweet Potatoes, Peeled and Sliced
instructions: Combine top grouping of ingredients in a 5 qt. or larger crockpot.
Cover and cook on low for 7 hours or until potatoes are tender.  Cool slightly.
Scoop mixture into a blender (as much as will fit).  Blend until smooth and add back into the crockpot.  Repeat and return to the crockpot.  Add almond milk, thyme, honey and nutmeg.  Stir and enjoy!

recipes.title: Steak and Root Vegetable Chili
ingredients: 2 Sweet Potatoes, Peeled and Cut into 1" Cubes
Optional: Chopped Green Onion for Garnish
instructions: In a large skillet, heat oil over med-high heat.  Add the meat and brown all sides for about 5 min.
Add all the ingredients to the slow cooker.  Stir well to combine.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.

recipes.title: Stuffed Acorn Squash
ingredients: 1 lb - Italian Seasoned Bulk Chicken Sausage
instructions: Place 1 cup of water in the bottom of slow cooker.  Cut the acorn squash in half, lengthwise, scoop out the seeds, and set aside.
In a large skillet, brown the sausage over medium heat.  Add the onions, mushrooms and spinach to the sausage, and cook for 1-2 minutes.  Remove from heat.
Stuff the cavity of the squash with as much of the mixture as you can (It is okay to overstuff them).  Carefully place them in the slow cooker, and repeat for the remaining squash halves.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 4 hours.

recipes.title: Jalapeno Sweet Potato Chowder
ingredients: 3 - Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, Cut to Stew Size Pieces
instructions: Cook the sweet potatoes the night before and store in the fridge.
The next day, place the chicken in the slow cooker.
Add the onions, carrots, celery, jalapeno peppers and coconut oil.
Scoop out the sweet potato insides and place in a blender with one cup of the chicken broth.  Puree until smooth and add to the slow cooker.
Add the coconut milk and remaining chicken broth and stir well.  Cover and cook on LOW for 4 hrs.  Uncover and cook on LOW for another half hour.  This will thicken the chowder.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Sausage Hash
recipes.notes: You can start this in the slow cooker before you go to bed and wake up to a ready-to-eat breakfast!
ingredients: 3 Medium Sweet Potatoes, peeled and grated
1 Box Applegate Farm Chicken and Sage Sausage, chopped
instructions: Peel the sweet potatoes, shred them with a grater, and place them in the slow cooker.
Add the rest of the ingredients and stir together.
Cover and cook on LOW for 6-8 hours.

recipes.title: Chai Exfoliating Face Scrub
instructions: In a small glass bowl, mix together all ingredients until well-combined.
Store in a small tightly-capped glass jar for up to 6 months.
To use, wet your skin. Scoop out a small amount of sugar scrub and gently rub into the skin in a circular motion to exfoliate. Rinse well.

recipes.title: Egg Substitutes
recipes.notes: Can also use 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce or 1/4 cup mashed banana.
instructions: Place the gelatin and hot water in a small glass bowl.
Blend together until it becomes frothy, about 30 seconds. Add immediately to your baking recipe.

recipes.title: Grain-Free All-Purpose Flour
instructions: Combine and mix all ingredients.
Store in an airtight canning jar in the fridge. Use to substitute regular flour in any recipe.

recipes.title: Grain-Free Baking Powder
instructions: Combine and mix all ingredients.
Store in an airtight canning jar in the fridge.

recipes.title: Homemade Citrus Cleaner
recipes.notes: Do not use vinegar solutions to clean granite, marble or stone.
instructions: Peel the lemons and place into a large glass jar with a lid.
Pour the entire bottle of vinegar over the top of the lemon peels.
Screw on the lid and let sit for 2-4 weeks.
Strain the liquid into a storage container. This is your concentrate. When ready to use, dilute with half vinegar solution and half water into a spray bottle.

recipes.title: Natural Powder Blush
recipes.notes: The amounts of each ingredient to use will vary per person. You will have to experiment to find out what works for you.
instructions: Start with 1 tsp arrowroot in a small 4 oz mason jar.
Add cocoa powder and hibiscus until you reach desired shade.
Measure each time you are adding something so once you find the perfect shade you can reproduce it easily.
Store in the 4 oz mason jar with a lid and apply with a blush brush.

recipes.title: Paleo Sandwich Bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and line a 4" x 8" loaf pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine all dry ingredients and set aside.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and egg whites, milk, vinegar and coconut oil.
Immediately stir the dry mixture into the wet mixture, stirring until moistened, but do not overmix.
Transfer the batter into the loaf pan and spread out evenly.
Bake for 60 minutes or until loaf has risen and top is a deep golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack for about 30 minutes, then remove from the pan by holding the sides of the parchment paper and continue to cool on the rack until fully cooled.
Slice as desired and store tightly in the fridge for up to 4 days. Bread can also be frozen.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Seeds
instructions: Remove and wash seeds.
Pat dry.
Mix with melted coconut oil.
Spread flat on a cookie sheet on unbleached parchment paper.
Bake at 275 degrees for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Strawberry Freezer Jam
ingredients: Pomona's Universal Low Sweetener Pectin (2 tsp pectin powder and 2 tsp calcium water)
instructions: Before beginning, make calcium water:  Mix 1/2 tsp calcium powder (smaller packet in Pamona's box) with 1/2 cup water in a jar with a lid.
Wash strawberries and cut off tops.
Rinse jars and fill with hot water.  Set aside.
Pulse blend the strawberries in the blender until it reaches desired consistency.
Pour strawberry puree into the saucepan, add 2 tsp calcium water, and stir.
Measure sugar into a separate bowl. Add 2 tsp pectin powder and thoroughly stir. Turn the saucepan burner up to med/high.
Bring strawberry puree to a boil, while stirring. Add sugar/pectin mixture and a dab of coconut oil and stir vigorously for 2 minutes to dissolve pectin. Return to a boil and remove from heat.
Pour water out of jars. Use a funnel to fill jars to 1/4 inches from the top.
Keep jars on the counter until they reach room temperature. Screw lids onto the jars, then freeze until ready to use. After removing from the freezer, store in the refrigerator.

recipes.title: Taco Seasoning
instructions: Combine and mix all ingredients.
Store in a small Mason jar with a lid.
